io.sphere.sdk.queries

Class ExperimentalReactiveStreamUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.sdk.queries.ExperimentalReactiveStreamUtils

  • public final class ExperimentalReactiveStreamUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utils to work with Reactive Streams.

    It is called for now experimental since we did not yet validated the implementation against the Technology Compatibility Kit for Reactive Streams. It is not the case that we want to remove this API.

    • Method Detail

      • publisherOf

        public static <T extends Identifiable<T>,C extends QueryDsl<T,C>> org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T> publisherOf(QueryDsl<T,C> seedQuery,
                                                                                                               SphereClient sphereClient)
        Creates a Publisher for fetching all resources (except ProductProjection and JsonNode, see publisherOf(QueryDsl, Function, SphereClient)) matching a predicate. The order should not be of importance.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resources to fetch (e.g. Category)
        C - the QueryDsl container
        Parameters:
        seedQuery - the query containing a predicate which resources should be fetched, reference expansion can also be used but the sort expressions are ignored
        sphereClient - the client performing the requests
        Returns:
        publisher
        See Also:
        publisherOf(QueryDsl, Function, SphereClient)

      • publisherOf

        public static <T,C extends QueryDsl<T,C>> org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T> publisherOf(QueryDsl<T,C> seedQuery,
                                                                                       java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.String> idExtractor,
                                                                                       SphereClient sphereClient)
        Creates a Publisher for fetching all resources matching a predicate including ProductProjection and JsonNode. The order should not be of importance.

        Exmaple for ProductProjection:

        final SphereClient client = getClient();
final ProductProjectionQuery seedQuery = ProductProjectionQuery.ofCurrent()
        .withPredicates(m -> m.categories().id().is("category-id"));
final Publisher<ProductProjection> productProjectionPublisher =
        ExperimentalReactiveStreamUtils.publisherOf(seedQuery, ProductProjection::getId, client);

        See the test code.

        Example for JsonNode:

        final Publisher<JsonNode> categoryPublisher =
        ExperimentalReactiveStreamUtils.publisherOf(JsonNodeQuery.of("/categories"), (JsonNode jsonNode) -> jsonNode.get("id").asText(), sphereClient());
final CompletionStage<List<JsonNode>> categoriesStage =
        ExperimentalReactiveStreamUtils.collectAll(categoryPublisher);
final List<JsonNode> categories = categoriesStage.toCompletableFuture().join();
assertThat(categories)
        .hasSize(15)
        .matches(cats -> cats.parallelStream().anyMatch(cat -> cat.get("slug").get("en").asText().equals("boots-women")));

        See the test code.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resources to fetch (e.g. ProductProjection)
        C - the QueryDsl container
        Parameters:
        seedQuery - the query containing a predicate which resources should be fetched, reference expansion can also be used but the sort expressions are ignored
        sphereClient - the client performing the requests
        idExtractor - function which takes as argument a resource and returns the ID of the resource
        Returns:
        publisher

      • collectAll

        public static <T> java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<java.util.List<T>> collectAll(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T> publisher)
